## The power of group_by()

`group_by()` doesn't change how your data looks â€” it changes how other verbs work on it. Think of it as setting up the "behind the scenes" grouping structure.

```r
data |>
  group_by(condition) |>
  summarize(mean = mean(score))
```
:::

### Psychology application

```r
# Calculate descriptive statistics by condition
experiment_data |>
  group_by(condition) |>
  summarize(
    M = mean(score, na.rm = TRUE),
    SD = sd(score, na.rm = TRUE),
    n = n()
  )
```
